body:
Sure, more input sounds good. We don't have a "Question" tag, but if you
want to ask around on mailing lists etc the please do.

On 1 October 2015 at 10:41, Alex Browne <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I just want to point out that while scanning open source go code is a good
> idea, it is not a one-to-one correspondence with the number of times this
> mistake has been made in the wild. Oftentimes, I imagine developers making
> the mistake, finding it (maybe after scratching their heads for a while
> like I did), and then fixing it without ever committing the broken code to
> version control.
>
> I also understand the desire to not make go vet too bloated, so getting
> some kind of metric for how often this happens makes sense. Would you be
> open to labelling this as question or something similar and gauging
> responses from the community as an additional metric for how useful this
> might be?
